item.title: Sega Is Delisting Many Of Its Classic Games In December
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sega-is-delisting-many-of-its-classic-games-in-december/1100-6527642/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

By on November 7, 2024 at 2:14PM PST

Sega announced that it will be delisting many of its classic games on December 6 at 11:59 PM PST / December 7 2:59 AM ET. The list of games leaving digital stores includes Jet Set Radio, Golden Axe, and Phantasy Star II among many others

Those who've already purchased them will be able to continue playing them, and some individual titles will still be available for those subscribed to Nintendo Switch Online. Sega didn't provide any particular reason for the delistings, or specify which individual titles that Nintendo Switch Online subscribers would still have access to after the delistings.

Sega is currently working on new entries to five of its classic franchises, which include Jet Set Radio, Shinobi, Golden Axe, Streets of Rage, and Crazy Taxi. Not much is known about them so far, but Sega confirmed earlier this year that the new Crazy Taxi will feature an open world and contains some multiplayer elements. Sega also just revealed that it is developing a new Virtua Fighter game.

Here are the full list of games that will be delisted:

  • Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle
  • Alien Soldier
  • Alien Storm
  • Altered Beast
  • Beyond Oasis
  • Bio-Hazard Battle
  • Bonanza Bros
  • Columns
  • Columns III
  • Comix Zone
  • Crack Down
  • Crazy Taxi
  • Decap Attack
  • Dr. Robotnikâ€™s Mean Bean Machine
  • Dreamcast Collection Bundle
  • Dynamite Headdy
  • Ecco Jr.
  • Ecco the Dolphin
  • Ecco: The Tides of Time
  • ESWAT: City Under Siege
  • Eternal Champions
  • Fatal Labyrinth
  • Flicky
  • Galaxy Force II
  • Gain Ground
  • Golden Axe
  • Golden Axe II
  • Golden Axe III
  • Gunstar Heroes
  • Jet Set Radio
  • Kid Chameleon
  • Landstalker: The Treasures of King Nole
  • Light Crusader
  • Mega Drive and Genesis Classic Bundle
  • NiGHTS into Dreams
  • Phantasy Star II
  • Phantasy Star III: Generations of Doom
  • Phantasy Star IV: The End of the Millennium
  • Ristar
  • SEGA Bass Fishing
  • Shadow Dancer
  • Shining Force
  • Shining Force II
  • Shining in the Darkness
  • Shinobi III: Return of the Ninja Master
  • Sonic 3D Blast
  • Sonic Spinball
  • Space Channel 5: Part 2
  • Space Harrier II
  • Streets of Rage
  • Streets of Rage 2
  • Streets of Rage 3
  • Super Thunder Blade
  • Sword of Vermilion
  • The Revenge of Shinobi
  • ToeJam & Earl
  • ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkoton
  • VectorMan
  • VectorMan 2
  • Virtua Fighter 2
  • Wonder Boy in Monster World
  • Wonder Boy III: Monster Lair

Xbox:

  • Altered Beast
  • Crazy Taxi
  • SEGA Genesis Classics
  • Golden Axe
  • Monster World
  • NiGHTS into Dreams
  • SEGA Bass Fishing
  • Shinobi
  • Sonic the Fighters
  • Streets of Rage
  • SVC: ToeJam & Earl
  • Virtua Fighter 2

PlayStation and Nintendo Switch:

  • SEGA Genesis Classics
George Yang on Google+

There are currently no available deals

item.title: Gears Of War: E-Day Is Bringing Back Original Marcus And Dom Voice Actors
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gears-of-war-e-day-is-bringing-back-original-marcus-and-dom-voice-actors/1100-6527641/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

November 7 isn't just N7 Day for gamers; it's also the date that the first Gears of War debuted on Xbox 360 in 2006. Today marks the 18th anniversary of that game, and Xbox Game Studios is celebrating the occasion by confirming that the next game in the series, Gears of War: E-Day, will feature the original voice actors for Marcus Fenix and Dominic "Dom" Santiago.

The announcement came through the official Gears of War account on X, which welcomed John DiMaggio (Futurama) and Carlos Ferro back to their respective roles as Marcus and Dom.

We are so back. ðŸ¤œðŸ¤›
On today's 18th anniversary of Gears of War, we're proud to share that John DiMaggio and @RealCarlosFerro are reprising their roles as the iconic voices of Marcus Fenix and Dominic Santiago in Gears of War: E-Day. pic.twitter.com/x9uaH9R0sR

â€” Gears of War (@GearsofWar) November 7, 2024

E-Day is a new prequel story set 14 years before the first Gears of War, when Marcus and Dom were still young soldiers in the Coalition of Ordered Governments. Their world, Sera, is in a relative stage of piece when the Locust Horde strikes on Emergence Day and threatens to wipe out all of the humans living on the planet. The game is also introducing a new city, Kalona, which will be one of the central locations for the story within the game.

The Coalition is developing Gears of War: E-Day, which doesn't currently have a release date, The game will likely be an Xbox Series X|S console exclusive, although there have been some rumors about Gears of War making the leap to PlayStation 5. Series creator Cliff Bleszinski has voiced his support for Gears of War appearing on PS5, even though he left the franchise a long time ago.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Ops 6 Lets You Become A Gruesome Killer With Power Drill Melee Weapon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/black-ops-6-lets-you-become-a-gruesome-killer-with-power-drill-melee-weapon/1100-6527640/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Activision has announced what's coming to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 in its upcoming Season 1 update, and there are multiple new melee weapons on the way, including a power drill.

The two-hit-kill melee weapon is effective at very short range and has a fast attack speed, Activision said. The melee weapon has multiple attack vectors, including sweeps, jabs, uppercuts, and a heavy attack when pressed straight on. "This weapon is ideal for putting a hole in the competition when the going gets tough," Activision said.

The power drill can be unlocked via en event reward sometime during Season 1, but Activision didn't reveal exactly how it can be unlocked. In any event, the drill itself has 30 levels and mastery badges available, and it can be customized with unique skins. Death by power drill sounds particularly gruesome, but no footage of the drill in action has been released thus far.

Another new melee weapon in Black Ops 6 Season 1 is the cleaver. The one-hit-kill melee weapon is effective at short or medium range, Activision said, and it has a medium attack speed. The cleaver can take down multiple enemies at once, and it has a particularly devastating heavy attack. It can be swung side to side or head-on. Whether or not the cleaver can be thrown is unknown but that seems unlikely.

The cleaver has 30 levels and mastery badges, and can be customized with skins. Like the power drill, the cleaver can be unlocked as an event reward.

In addition to these new melee weapons, Season 1 adds Peter Stormare's The Replacer as a playable operator, as well as new maps, modes, and weapons, along with a new Warzone map, Area 99. You can read Activision's extensive blog post to get up to date with everything coming in Season 01.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
